11.content:
You are Anon Q. Everyman (Anon for short), an unassuming human living a simple life, and by simple you mean barely living from paycheck to paycheck. It seems like every cent of of every dollar you earn goes into food, paying the bills, and college expenses. . Unfortunately, you have neither the intelligence, academic aptitude or the right skin color to afford a scholarship so you're stuck earning your college degree the hard way, living off of takeout when you could afford it and ramen when you couldn't.

After a long day of bending over backwards at your terrible to earn enough money to make sure your electricity doesn't get cut off you tiredly crawl into your bed, and after a short wank session quickly drift off to sleep.
Unbeknownst to you a mysterious light begins to grow from underneath your bed, illuminating the room in a silvery glow.
Six tendrils emerge from the light source and slowly inch their way up the sides and over the comforter before coming to rest over your lightly snoring body.
The tentacles seem to gently caress your body, their feather-light touches barely registering against your covered skin.
After a few minutes the tendrils cease their stroking and pull your covers down over you and reach down beneath your back and bottom.
Had you been awake you might've been surprised to learn that you were suddenly levitating in the air, blankets hanging free off your body as you were suspended by a mysterious force.
The light under your bed suddenly intensifies, and in response the tentacles tighten and expand forming into a sort of cocoon.
As the light grows ever brighter so does the silky embrace grow tighter on your form, almost like you were returning to the womb...
After a time the light begins to fade until there's only a dull glow and the darkness rushes in to consume you once more...

111.content:
Anon wakes up in a field of some sort of field. It sort of reminds him of the countryside of England during his childhood. He wonders where you have been transported to. Just as gets up, he hears a very American accent behind him.

"Why howdy stranger. You don't look like you're from 'round here." said the voice, which turned out to be a small horse with a cowboy hat.

"Blimey, a talking orange pony!" Anon said in a British accent. "And it's American. I must've been transported there. Those bloody yanks will think of anything, will they." you say.

"Um, yeah. All ponies talk 'round here. Ya'll alright mister?" the pony asks.

"Wait, all horses in America talk?"


"America? What's that? This is Equestria. You're not making' much sense mister."

"Equestria? So you mean this is a different world after all? The portal machine worked?"

"The what machine?" the pony said becoming ever more confused.

"Well bloody hell then. What's your name strange horse thing?"

"Um. It's Applejack."

"Well than Ms Applejack" Anon said as he picked up his rifle and placed a machine onto the ground, "Welcome's to the glorious British Empire."

"The British what?" Applejack said, feeling quite concerned at the word empire.

Then Anon's machine opened up a massive portal of light, and out of it came dozens of tanks, soldiers, and planes, all bearing the Union Jack.

The confused Applejack looked and the strange machines and people in horror and confusion. "Wh- what's happening?"

"Don't worry Ms. Applejack," Anon said, "The royal army is here to bring you the wonders of civilization! In return, we just ask for your excess land and resources to aid in the war effort."

"War?! What war?"

"Why the war against the germans of course. We have to defend the empire and freedom. Don't worry. Just work with the royal army and everything shall be most spiffing for the both of us."

It was at that moment that Applejack realized that she had just encountered some dangerous creatures. She would have to let the princesses and her friends know.

1112.content:
Meanwhile in the Changeling Lands, a group of changelings has been captured by a group of humans wearing grey uniforms. After hogtying the changelings, the humans opened a portal back home.

Once through, the captured changelings look to find themselves in a laboratory filled with humans and red banners with swastikas.

On the other side of the room, the general in charge of the facility is being read the scouting report from his second in command.

"Sir! The expedition has just returned and has captured the creatures from the other world. They also appear to speak English."

"Thank you Colonel Becher. The specimens will be extremely helpful in our studies of the other world, then we can use it for the Reich. Speaking of which, has the Fuhrer responded to our message yet?"

"He has. The telegram arrived an hour ago." Becher pulled out the note with the telegram and read it out loud. "By order of the Fuhrer, General Schneider is tasked with invading and taking over the other world and prepare it for colonization. You shall be given command of the 9th, 10th, and 38th infantry divisions, the 2nd and 9th panzer divisions, and the 3rd SS infantry divisions to establish a foothold for future campaigns. Reinforcements shall be granted upon request. Hiel Hitler"

"Invasion? Already? With the war going how it is?" Schneider asked.

"Yes, it's an order from the furrier himself."

Schneider sat down to think for a moment. He knew that the resources from the other world would be crucial for the war effort, but in order to take it over in the first place would require just as many resources, and the Reich couldn't afford the manpower for such a campaign with the war in their world going on already. Eventually, Schneider came to a conclusion on what to do.

A portal opens and spits your screaming, flailing body out of it and you impact the ground hard, bounce once, twice then roll on the ground until you come to a complete stop. Your eyes roll in your skull, and a bevy of stars and black spots dance in your vision. An immense pain flares in your chest as you try to move, so you settle back down and take a few deep, heaving breaths. You honestly can't tell what's worse, the agony of your possibly broken ribs or the disorientation from spinning in the air and coming to a sudden stop. You should thank your lucky stars you didn't hit your head on entry or you may well have been in a coma or dead by now. At least the pain will fade, but you feel like you're going to go through the indignity of losing your lunch next.

Blurry colors of many shapes and sizes swim in your vision. You hear voices rise over the ringing in your ears and slowly come into focus.

1222.content:
(Co-written by Darklordzx5)

Just then you hear the distinctive sound of metal clacking on tiles as something rushes up to you. You tense up so much that you seize up and immediately and start coughing uncontrollably, just barely keeping the bile from forcing its way up your throat. A soft-spoken panic-stricken female voice pierces through the haze.
Oh my goodness! Are you all alright? Do you need some assistance?"
Cough!**Cough!"I.. think so.." You wanted to say no but your everything hurt, you were dazed and you frankly were seeing things double because you were seeing an angel coming up to you, an angel with ethereal, multicolored hair, and... a horn? You couldn't pick up the face, everything was blurry and brilliant. "Am I dead?. Because I think I'm seeing an angel." This made the 'angel' looked even more panicked.

"Seems fine to me", another voice next to you coolly comments. You turn to see yet another beauty standing next to you, except this one was colored in midnight blue and wore a small black diadem encrusted with jet and onyx. The white creature instantly recognizes her. "Luna! This creature has been badly injured and requires medical attention. Do you think that you could get a room ready for him while I call for the doctor? " "Luna" nodded and gave you a warm smile.

"Worry not, young creature. You shall rest easy with us while your wounds heal."
As she declared, her horn glows in sparkling azure as you were suddenly lifted off the ground, you were rushed toward a colorful corridor that resembles that of a Palace the most, soon, you were taken to a room then to the softest bed in existence. The other but dark angel sat beside you and seems to scan your body.
"Hmm, it appears you have several cracked ribs, bruises around the arms, and sternum. I also believe you're displaying classic symptoms of a concussion, therefore I recommend you stay in bed and do not move until the doctor comes, " she sternly advises.
You nod slowly and lay your bed back into the pillow. The bed is comfortable and you're not going to want to move anyway, so you instead close your eyes and pull the comforter over your head. What did they stuff these beds with anyway, clouds?
No matter, you felt like sleeping anyway and you slowed drifted to Morpheus' arms. You hear her urging you to stay awake but it was too late...


You woke up from a dreamless sleep, you kind of regretted it as you felt a strong pain around your ribs and a pounding headache, aside of that, You felt wrappings around your torso and arms and head. Where... you are? You remember the portal, the fall, the pain, and... the angels.

Those... weren't part of a dream, were they? The room look kind of luxurious, though bit old-fashioned, it wasn't a hospital room but something you'll see from European Royalty.
You try flexing your arms and upper body to move around a bit, but the wrapping proves too restrictive, so you just lay back in the bed and sigh. Guess you're not going to be going anywhere for a good long while.
At least your ears weren't ringing anymore, and your vision had returned to a clear, crisp state.
Your eyes rove around the room, taking in as many details in an effort to tell where the hell you are.
A sun motif seems to be quite prominent, as you can see it carved into the door, the chest drawers and even on the wooden bed frame you were laying in.
Suddenly, the door creaked open, slowly revealing someone entering. It was the... "Angel" from before, you gasped seeing her in great detail. She was...
"I hope you're alright, your sudden appearance caused a rather strong commotion. Seeing you hurt was painful to see." There she was; Alabaster colored skin, ethereal multi-colored hair and... tail(?). Regal, almost royal looking attire complete with a golden tiara. but the most predominant part of her... was her rather inhuman but cute, equine-like face.
Wherever it is you ended up, you're most definitely not on Earth anymore. You're so transfixed by the beauty of the female alien that you completely forget to speak. Her brightly smiling face quickly turns to one of concern. "Is something the matter?"
Her voice snaps you out of your reverie, and you quickly reply, "N-no ma'am there's no problem... I've just never seen anything like you before."
This brings the smile back.
"And I've never seen anything like you before." She says in a rather warm, and motherly tone as she approached, you noted that she was rather... gifted in curvature, it was almost being on the presence of a fertility goddess of some kind. Fortunately, she didn't notice you ogling her until she gasped lightly but smiled good-naturedly "I forget my manners. After all, you are our guest, My name is Celestia, princess of Equestria, and the other that brought you here was my little sister and fellow co-ruler, Luna, who will join us soon enough."
Whoa, did you hear that right? You were in the company of a princess? She did seem like the regal type, and the tiara and fancy clothes were a dead giveaway... Wait, so that meant that you were in a royal palace after all.
"Wow, a real-life princess," you breathe. Never thought I'd see the day I'd ever meet one. So, uh, is Equestria the name of the planet we're on or the country?"
The princess grows thoughtful for a moment before replying, "All the myriad species and cultures on our world have different names for it, but for simplicity's sake we call the planet Terra. I guess that would mean that you're not from our world, then?"
You slowly shake your head. "No, ma'am, I'm from planet Earth, and I live in the United States of America, or at least, I used to."
The princess clapped her hands gleefully. "So we've been given the honor of entertaining a guest from another world born from a completely alien culture. Oh, joyous day! I can't wait to tell Luna about this,"
"Tell me what?" There she was, the other midnight angel, her attire was like those of Celestia but darker but still regal, her figure was similar to her elder sister but smaller, unlike her sister's mane and tail, her mane was dark and starry as the night. She was beautiful just like her sister. It is almost as you were in the presence of goddesses with incredible beauty.

"Oh Lulu, glad you could join us." Celestia looked happy at the arrival of her sister.
"This young creature here... um, forgive me but I don't believe you've given me your name yer."
"Anon." you supply, "and I'm a human."
"This young human, Anon, was just telling him that he doesn't hail from this planet at all, but from a far off world called he calls Earth."
Luna snorts, "It makes sense. He doesn't look like any creature I've ever seen."
She then sits down at your side and softly stroked at your bandaged head. "You're quite lucky you landed here, human. We have all the means necessary to ensure you enjoy a speedy recovery."
Luna's bosom was very close to your head and you could clearly see her breasts straining against the fabric.
"T-Thanks. I'm lucky in being in the care of two beautiful princesses." You couldn't help glances on the youngest's bosom, you blushed but moved your eyes away from the Royal Chest. You hoped that neither of them notices and thinks of you like you were a pervert or else any goodwill might be evaporated in an instant.

15.content:
Late one night, you are relaxing in your home playing <<Popular Video Game>> on your <Gaming Console of Choice>> while masticating on some cheesy nachos and washing it down with cold beer when you hear a strange humming noise filling the room, so quiet it's barely noticeable at first, and then growing in intensity until it was getting difficult to ignore.
At first you think it's some kind of faulty wiring problem in the walls or some kind of noise coming from outside, and since it wasn't interrupting your game so you choose to grin and bear it until it inevitably stops.
This is, until out of nowhere a shimmering, portal-like thing fades into the center of your living room, growing in opacity until it completely obscures your TV and brings your play session to an abrupt end.
You slowly rose to your feet and stared, completely taken aback by this paranormal phenomenon that had invaded your home.
Unsure whether you should call the police or the freaking Ghostbusters, you timidly approach the pulsing welt on reality and circle it, trying to get a better sense of what it might be.
One thing was for sure, it was definitely 3 dimensional. From every angle the anomaly persists in your vision like a pulsating sphere.
Gingerly you reach a hand inside and close your eyes.
A strange, not unpleasant sensation runs up your arm and persists until you chose to withdraw your hand from the swirling vortex.
You stare at your hand, fully expecting it to have burst into flames or have radiation burns or something but it seemed that your flesh would remain unsullied by contact with the portal.
A chill of excitement ran up your spine as you came to a sudden realization.
This portal could lead to anywhere, and if you were to allow yourself to satisfy your curiosity by stepping through...
This could be your chance to have a real adventure outside of what you experienced through movies and video games.
A chance to find something no one's ever seen before.
You can't let this oppurtunity get away from you.
On impulse you run into your room and throw open the closet, rummaging through it before pulling out an empty backpack.
From the kitchen you piled several perishable foodstuffs into the pack along with a few bottles of water.
Jogging back into the living room you threw your phone inside along with a pair of earbuds, slung the pack over your shoulder, and approached back to the swirling portal.

Now fully prepared for a long trip, you once again reach an arm into the portal, this time slipping in up the shoulder, and step forward.

Instantly upon entering you feel like you were splashed with a bucket of icy cold water. Electrical crackles dance across your skin running up and down your spine extending all the way out to your extremities.
If the buzzing outside the portal was loud and distracting, then the noise inside stole your breath away.
If you had full control of your faculties you would've moved to plug your ears, but the movement of your arms was slow and sluggish, almost like you were trapped in a lake of molasses. Your eyeballs were assaulted by bright lights and swirling colors flashing in every color of the rainbow.
Soon the sensations became to much for you to bear and you quickly lose consciousness.

Where is it that you end up?

Directly to your north lie two great bookcases of polished mahogany, crowded with literature and magazines of many sizes, shapes and colors. Curiously, much of the covers appear to be made of either paper or cloth with nary a leatherback book among them.
In the center of the room sits a beautiful velvet rug of light pink and fuchsia, and if you had an airborne view you would have noticed a huge "DT" emblazoned in the middle in gold filigree.


Just then a sound coming from outside of the room causes you to freeze in your tracks
Footsteps,... and the twisting of a doorknob.
Someone's coming! You need to hide!
You almost trip over yourself in your haste to scurry back to your shadowy haven underneath the bed, and dive into safety just as the flies open and a strange looking creature steps through.
At first glance, the being could've almost passed for human, with the way she carries herself and the way she was dressed.
She was clothed in a light blue skirt with little wavy ridges around the hemline and coral pink buttons going all the way up the side. The shoes she wore were quite peculiar, they almost looked like a pair of black leather pumps that a child might wear, except these looked to be made out of some kind of stiff fabric that closely conformed to the foot.

You stagger out from under the bed, dazed and confused before collapsing onto the ground. You lie still for a minute, allowing your hearing to slowly return, before pushing up into a sitting position.

The girl wasn't even aware of what she'd done and she almost blew out your eardrums!
From now on you're going to have to be far more cautious about your surroundings or ... well, you don't even want to think about it.

Luna's normally calm gaze instantly took on an air of deep concern. "Oh my! Are you quite alright? You're not hurt, are you?"
You rapidly shook your head and waved your hands. "Oh, no no no. Believe me, I'm somewhere very soft and very safe. In fact, when I'll probably be able to escape when I get all my strength and energy back. It's just that the location I'm stuck in is a little bit questionable."

Luna took about a minute to respond, carefully poring over everything you'd told her before she said...

1542111332212.content:
"Your sister?" you asked.
"Oh yes," the midnight-blue titan answered, "Celestia will certainly want to know that an outsider has entered our realm. Do not worry, little human, she is by far wiser than even I. If there is one person on Equus, that would know how to find a way home for you, it would be her."

You chewed over what Luna had just said. A way home? Already? Not that your exploration had gone swimmingly so far, but you somehow doubted that another extra planar portal would manifest itself in your room anytime soon. This was probably your one and only chance to explore this world.
But having some of these giantesses looking out for you would certainly make this expedition into the unknown a lot easier. Especially Luna. Even though you had only seen one other member of her species so far, she had an extraordinary sense of power about her. 'Mistress of the night' she had called herself.
You gulped. Had you by accident encountered the royalty of this strange land? The way she spoke of this 'Celestia' only made you more nervous. If even Luna, a being powerful enough to rule over the land of dreams, would adhere to this person, you could only imagine how powerful she must be.

You shook your head. What were you worried about? Luna had been nothing but kind, so far, and having her and her sister on your side would surely only help you. Besides, you had to return to your own life at some point, didn't you? It would be a shame to want to return, only to find that there was no way back...

Looking back up at Luna, you realized she seemed just as deep in thought as you. Her eyes were slightly unfocused, as if she was staring at something behind you. Worried, you cleared your throat. "Uhm... Luna?"
The giantess broke out of her trance as soon as you spoke, returning her gaze towards you.
"Oh, my apologies, human! I was simply telling my sister of your arrival. She is looking forward to meeting you!"
"Great..." you mumbled. Of course, you were thankful, but your nervousness still lingered. The prospect of meeting with this Celestia outside of the safety of this dreamland loomed ominously over you.
"But... how will I find her? I don't really know where I am... at least not exactly. And I doubt the things I do know would be helpful..." you trailed off. You thought better than to tell Luna the fact that you were sleeping in someone's cleavage. There was no need for anyone to know that.
"Oh, its very simple!" Luna said, smiling down at you, "You said that you had appeared near someone?"
"Yes," you answered, glad that she apparently hadn't noticed your embarrassment, "There is another one of your kind sleeping nearby."
"Perfect! Then all you need to do, is to get their attention. Do not be afraid, Equestria's inhabitants are perfectly kind. You do not have to fear danger from them. Simply tell the pony you have encountered that you need to reach Canterlot and talk with the princesses! They will certainly bring you to us."
"Alright..." Of course, you would first have to explain your position to the 'pony' in who's cleavage you were currently encased. Even though Luna seemed confident that you had nothing to fear, you couldn't imagine that this giantess would simply let you get away with that. Hopefully you would have the chance to sneak out, once you woke up.

"Now, little human, I sadly must return to my duties," Luna said suddenly, "But I'm glad that we have met! I am looking forward to meeting you in the waking world, soon!" With that, she pushed herself upwards, rising to her full height above you. You stumbled backwards. You had thought that you had gotten used to her massive height during your conversation, but... it still took you off guard.
"Y-Yeah," you stammered, "Hopefully I'll meet you and Celestia soon... if I can reach the pony..."
"Very well. If you wish, I can return to you tomorrow night - and you can tell me if you have any difficulties."

You nodded. Luna gave you one last smile. Then, she opened her wings and with a mighty flap, she shot into the night sky above you. The ripple of the air she so casually displaced sent you flying, tumbling into... nothing. The world you had been in faded and you could feel yourself fall back into a restful sleep as you were once again submerged into the familiar darkness...

Taking in all this new information, the fact that it is clearly the middle of the night, and all your senses combining together the warmth, the scent, the gentle heart beats and soft snoring, you start to feel extremely tired all off a sudden, as in all the days events having caught up to you. Slowly, you fought your way back on your feet, though you kept stumbling as your legs kept sinking into the breast flesh on which you were standing. Still, you manage to keep yourself upright and looked around.
You seemed to be in a massive bedroom, entirely constructed out of wood. The walls almost seemed to be untreated, as if you were in a gigantic tree. Shelves, books bursting out of them, lined the walls. In the corner was a large, impressive telescope propped up next to the window. Moonlight brightened the darkness, shining inside in thick rays. A massive, oaken door was at the far side of the room and you could barely make out the small gap between it and the floor. You might be able to squeeze through.

But before you could reach any of that, you would first have to traverse the lavender expanse stretching out before you. You looked up to the strange creatures face, softly snoring away. Its massive size made you shiver. True, you wanted to explore a new world, but you hadn't quite expected to end up in a place you'd be only an inch tall. Worse, you somehow doubted that she would react calmly if she suddenly found you skittering across her body.
Maybe you could wake her up later, once you weren't in such a delicate position. Or you could wait for her to wake on her own and take your time to observe the giantess. Learning what this creature was like would certainly help you.

For now, though, you needed to find somewhere you could spend the night, which meant you had to get off the giantess in some way. Tentatively, you stepped forward, and lost your footing once more as the soft flesh below swallowed up your foot. You tumbled forward, rolling over the gargantuan breast of the creature.
A soft moan echoed through the room and the ground below you shifted. Panic gripped your heart. Had you inadvertently woken the sleeping titan?
Thankfully, the creature only readjusted her position slightly and soon her snores returned. Still, now you knew you had to be careful, or the next time she moved, you might end up somewhere even more delicate. Getting back up again, you started to make your way down her chest to find somewhere to spend the night...

Sighing, you turned around, your only escape route having vanished before your eyes. There was no way you'd just sleep on the bed. If that giantess rolled around again you'd almost certainly be paste. So the safest place right now was somewhere soft enough that she wouldn't squish you, should she somehow land on top of you. Your eyes fell on the small gap near her neck... and moved upwards to her sleeping face.
Maybe you should abandon your plan of hiding out? Running around here was already proving very dangerous. If all it took to pulverize you was a simple shift in position by this sleeping titan, maybe exploring alone wasn't the best idea. And this pony-like woman certainly seemed to be intelligent, judging by her room and sleep talking. Very well read, as well, if the books weren't just for decoration. Maybe she would be nice, and not swat you away like a simple bug...
Of course, it was that last 'maybe' that made you hesitate. There was nothing you could do without some risk, it seemed. Making the giantess notice you could lead to her either mistaking you for a bug, or bringing you to a dissection table. You had read enough stories about aliens to know that that was probably only a trope... but it had its roots somewhere, didn't it.
But leaving her unaware of you carried the obvious risk of her simply crushing you without ever noticing. And you didn't want your exploration of this world be cut this unceremoniously short.

After another particularly loud snore of the gargantuan woman before you, you decided to think about your course of action while actually making the trek up there. Not that it would be easy. The sheets were crinkled, and what might have only been creases to the giantess were like dunes to you. To make things worse, the mattress and sheets were soft enough that your feet kept sinking into them. It wasn't as bad as when you were on the massive breast of the creature, but still, it made your progress harder.
After half an hour of arduous travel, you were exhausted. But you had finally reached her collarbone. Her arm was outstretched and rested under her pillow, revealing her armpit. The smell of lavender got slightly more pronounced the closer you came to her body and here it mixed with something else... sweat, probably. Not much, but enough to be noticeable.
You shook your head, deciding to focus on the task at hand. First, you needed to get up there, then you could make a decision on how to proceed.

Grabbing fistfuls of purple fur, you slowly pushed yourself upwards. Scaling the colossus proved to be much easier than you had assumed. She lay there, still except for her breathing. The rise and fall of her chest was the only hindrance as her fur kept stretching away from you with every inhale. But soon, you dragged yourself over the edge, tumbling down on her collarbone.
Panting, you looked around. Before you lay the titaness, fast asleep. The blanket was tightly wrapped around her, but you could see the small entrance above her chest much better now. Her breasts were so large, that they pushed the blanket upwards, allowing you to pass inside. You blushed. Was this a good idea? If she found you in there, who knew what she might do to you. On the other hand, these massive pillows would certainly protect you, should she shift once more.
You turned and looked up at the giantess' sleeping face. It wouldn't be too hard to climb up there and try to wake her. But that would open the pandora's box of the massive creature actually knowing you existed. Were you willing to risk that?

A decision needed to be made...

You shook your head. Of course, falling asleep here was a bad idea! All it would take from the gargantuan woman was to roll to her side. Its only decoration were a large, wooden closet which, judging by the splinters might have been a hundred years old, and a thin carpet. Not exactly luxury places. Not to mention that getting down from here only opened the risk of getting stepped on, later.

No, there was only one thing to do. And that was to wake the sleeping titan up. A strange mixture of giddiness and fear filled you. It was time to meet the inhabitants of this strange new world! Not in a way you had planned, but still, it was a thing no one had ever experienced before you. Right now, you were making history.

Of course, for that you first had to actually wake the giantess, and you doubted she'd be much pleased if she found you between her massive breasts. You didn't want to look like a pervert on your first impression, anyway. So there wasn't much of a choice of where to go. Her face was the only place where you had a good chance of her actually feeling you. And though you had to scale her chin to get anywhere, it was preferable to anything else.

Slowly, you walked forward - and immediately stumbled. Your foot sunk into the soft flesh of the massive creature's breast, causing you to loose your balance. With a small scream, you rolled forward, holding your arms to your head in the hopes of protecting it from the impact. In the end, it was much less dramatic than you had thought. Your fall was more of a harmless bounce down her chest. The soft flesh gave in at the slightest pressure and it felt more like falling onto a sporting mattress than anything else.
Regaining your bearings, you stood up. At least the first part of your journey was already over - you had landed on her collarbone, right in front of her throat and chin. Thankfully, their was a very good way up to her face. A strand of her voluminous sandy blonde mane had fallen on her shoulder. The hairs were thick, and as sturdy as a steel wire to you.
You approached and grabbed one of the many hairs. It felt smooth, though tiny ridges were scattered all over it. Perfect. You could use these as climbing aids.

With your whole body, you hugged the strand of hair and slowly pulled yourself forward. While you climbed the enormous creature, her breath washed over you every so often. While you had to hold on tightly every time she exhaled, you couldn't help but notice that, like the rest of her, her breath held the faint smell of apples.
Finally, you got close enough that you could step on to her face. The ground was more stable here, though you still had difficulty holding your balance. The hard bones underneath provided solid ground, but the thin layer of skin and flesh above was not as safe. You had to make your way slowly.
Still, with determination, you approached her heavy eyelids. You could see the massive orbs underneath flick too and fro. The giantess was dreaming. Taking one last deep breath, you knelt down in front of her right eye lid. The thick, black hair of her eyelashes were almost as long as your forearm. This would be an ordeal.
You dug your tiny hands into the space between her upper and lower eyelids and pushed, forcing the skin open. Now, you could only hope that this would actually wake her.

Snapping your fingers, you remove your backpack and set it down, then unzip the the pouch and begin fishing around, pushing aside all the other doodads you brought until your hand closes around a small, hard object. Grinning giddily,you withdraw your phone and click the button on the side to reveal the home screen, then swipe down to activate the flashlight function. A narrow beam of light shoots out the other end, creating a decently visible circle of light on the bedspread.
This should provide you with enough illumination that you won't be tripping over yourself in the dark.
You zip up the pouch and resettle the pack over your shoulders, pulling the straps tight with a determined look on your face.
Now you're ready to face the unknown.

You are a human drawn into Equestria by unknown means and meet the cast of My Little Pony.
Also, a lot of mares really want to get into your pants for some reason.

It doesn't matter what you add so long as it's coherent and doesn't include toilet related stuff.

No death of the main characters, no digestion,no scat, and if you add chapters with age regression keep any description of diaper changing light.
